description.narrative: CHILDREN'S RIGHT TO SOCIAL PROTECTION - a) Child poverty measured and monitored and increasingly translated into effective social protection policy responses, including through increasing the number of children (in the poorest quintile, and among socially vulnerable groups such as migrants, minorities and children with disabilities) receiving regular and predictable social transfers and b) Integrated models of social protection for cash and care to the most vulnerable children are developed., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Partners supported to provide supportive and caring environment for all children, especially the most vulnerable, focusing on prevention measures

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Linking cash to other programs, information and services (information on essential family practices, livelihoods, psycho-social support, etc.)
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Europe and Central Asia Regional Evaluation Reports
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: CHILDREN’S RIGHT TO SOCIAL PROTECTION - a) Child poverty measured and monitored and increasingly translated into effective social protection policy responses, including through increasing the number of children (in the poorest quintile, and among socially vulnerable groups such as migrants, minorities and children with disabilities) receiving regular and predictable social transfers; and b) Integrated models of social protection for cash and care to the most vulnerable children are developed.

description.narrative: Progress has been achieved in all areas: five countries have been capacitated in child poverty measurement; seven countries received support on shock-responsive social protection; seven country offices are generating evidence on the effectiveness of national social protection systems or programmes on reducing child poverty and deprivation. In addition, all country offices have been supported to increase their engagement with domestic public finance and budgeting for child-focused social services. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2019

title.narrative: 2.10 Cash transfers: Cash transfer system is being effectively IMPLEMENTED including the expanding coverage and improving inclususion of children (e.g. beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms).
2.1 Evidence: Existence of data and evidence on how social protection systems are responding to child poverty and deprivations (such as health, education, nutrition etc...)
3.2 Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children
1.1 National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures
2.13 Beneficiaries of cash transfers are linked with other programs information and services
